text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the official Vietnamese press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
-- Communist Party Secretary General Do Muoi has described small but profitable domestic businesses as being key to Vietnam's plan for modernization in the next decade.
-- Do Muoi says Vietnam wants to tightens relations with Nepal.
-- A State Bank official has said Vietnam has no plans to depreciate its currency and wants to maintain financial stability.
-- The United Nations Development Programme has decided to finance a $500,000 project to help Vietnam balance cultural and economic development between rural and urban areas.
-- Foreign Minister Nguyen Manh Cam says Vietnam is becoming more actively involved in ASEAN activities.
-- Defence Minister Doan Khue has ended a visit to Bulgaria, and arrived in Paris on Monday on an official friendship visit at the invitation of the French Defence Minister.
-- Vietnam and France have signed an agreement on measures to reinforce and strengthen defence ties.
-- Prime Minister Vo Van Kiet has called for more focus on irrigation and transportation work in the southern Mekong Delta area.
